skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: t. mobile
Developer Terms of Use
des:
T-Mobile with Alexa is a convenient and easy way to make and receive hands-free calls on your Alexa-enabled device. 

T-Mobile postpaid customers with a T-Mobile ID can link their existing T-Mobile phone number to their Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Show and make and receive calls when their phone is out of reach, turned off, or out of battery. 

To link your T-Mobile account with Alexa,
1. Click on “Launch.”
2. Enter T-Mobile account username/ password using T-Mobile ID.
3. Select mobile number.
4. Confirm or Update the Emergency address to complete the account linking.

Note: After account linking is completed, you can make and receive calls with all Echo devices linked to your Alexa account.

If your mobile number doesn't display when you attempt to link...
1. Go to myDIGITS.t-mobile.com.
2. Sign in with the Primary Account Holder's T-Mobile ID.
3. Choose the line that you wish to grant a user access to.
4. Choose Add myself to provide your T-Mobile ID with access to the line.
5. Reattempt linking through Alexa app.

If you wish to manage call settings, such as disabling incoming calls or selecting specific Echo devices for communication,
1. On the Alexa app, click “More” in the bottom right corner.
2. Select Settings.
3. Select Communications.
4. Click on T-Mobile.
5. Toggle off incoming calls (or) unselect Echo devices to avoid communications.

In times of emergency, Alexa can call for help, by saying, “Alexa, call 911.” 

You are required to provide T-Mobile with the address at which all Alexa devices associated with your account are being used in order to support routing of 911 calls to your local authorities. All devices linked to the same line must be used at the same location, and you agree to update that address before using them in another location. If you update the 911 address using Alexa or any other device, it will update the 911 registered location for all devices linked with that line. In some circumstances, access to 911 may be limited. See T-Mobile Terms and Conditions for additional 911 information.
 
Never miss a call again- answer mobile calls on Alexa devices. Learn more at https://www.t-mobile.com/support/plans-features/t-mobile-with-alexa
